```{r}
library(readxl)
library(caret)
library(corrplot)
tel<-read_xlsx("C:\\Users\\Ali\\Documents\\Texas State\\My Research\\Data\\Data preparation\\telehandlers preparation for market size.xlsx")

set.seed(1234)
```
now we split the data into train and test data set
```{r}
ind<-createDataPartition(tel$Year,p=0.8,list = FALSE)
train<-tel[ind,]
test<-tel[-ind,]
```
Deleteing N/A variables
```{r}
nearzero<-nearZeroVar(train,saveMetrics = TRUE)
train<-train[,!nearzero$nzv]
```
```{r}
View(train)
```
Columsn 1 and 2 are not needed 
```{r}
train<-train[,-c(1,2)]
```
the cor can be checked
```{r}
corrplot(cor(tel[,3:14]),method = "number")
```
```{r}
c<-findCorrelation(cor(train[,-1]),cutoff = 0.85)
names(train[c])
```
```{r}
c<-findCorrelation(cor(train[,-1]),cutoff = 0.75)
names(train[c])
```
principal component analysis can be applied for preprocess
```{r}
tc<-trainControl(method = "repeatedcv",number = 5,repeats = 3,preProcOptions = "pca")
```
```{r}
svmradial<-train(TMT~.,data=train,method="svmRadial",trControl=tc)
 p<-predict(svmradial,newdata = test)
svmradial
p

plot(svmradial)
```
now linear svm
```{r}
svmlinear<-train(TMT~.,data=train,method="svmLinear",trControl=tc)
svmlinear
p<-predict(svmlinear,test)
p
```
the neural netwrok
```{r}
 nn<-train(TMT~.,data=train,method="nnet",trControl=tc)
nn
p<-predict(nn,test)
p

plot(nn)
```
Random forest
```{r}
RF<-train(TMT~.,data=train,method="rf",trControl=tc)
p<-predict(RF,test)
RF
p
plot(RF)
```
